metadata.Title: CVE-2021-24031 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the Zstandard command-line utility prior to v1.4.1, output files were created with default permissions. Correct file permissions (matching the input) would only be set at completion time. Output files could therefore be readable or writable to unintended parties.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-24031` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzstd1 - 1.3.1+dfsg-1~ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
zstd - 1.3.1+dfsg-1~ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libzstd package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.1+dfsg-1~ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm3').
